Hit the Ground Running: Semester Starts

Sep 3, 2008

I got back to New York the night before classes started.  It’s not as crazy as it sounds.  I’m glad to fall right into a schedule after being self-directed all summer.  I’m starting my last year of the dual BA/BFA degree at the New School.  My concentration at Eugene Lang is History, and my concentration at Parsons is Design + Technology.

What am I taking this semester?

Cold War Media, Technology, and Culture – This history course is taught by Orit Halpern, who has a reputation at the New School for being a brilliant young star.  The course explores the sociocultural impact of technology emerging after WWII, with a focus on the changing relationship of bodies, machines, and minds.  I am thrilled to be addressing the themes I encounter in the Design+Technology from a historical context.

Thesis 1 – We’ve been warned that the mid-semester presentation is the point of no return.  We’ve got to know what we are making and stick with it though to the senior show.  Full speed ahead!  Dave Carroll, is a mainstay of the D+T department.  His specialty is mobile and interactive media.

Intro to Databases: PHP and MySQL – As far as I can tell, it’s pretty simple to learn the syntax of these languages.  The real challenge is in constructing efficient databases and systems for using them.  Maybe I’m wrong about that, we’ll see.  I’m kinda chomping at the bit to get back into code after a semester break.  The class is taught by Jamie Kosoy, senior developer at Big Space Ship.  To put it simply, he knows his stuff.

Advanced Flash: Actionscripting – If the databases class will teach me how to build the engine, this class will teach me how to paint and polish the body.  Catherine Garnier is the professor.  I hope my love for code won’t override my need to master the visual aspects of Flash.

Digital Audio and Video – Finally I will be working on some Final Cut Pro.  I worked with Robert Millazzo, the class professor, last fall.  His 5 Obstructions class was a roller coaster.  I appreciate it in retrospect, so I’m back for more.

Portuguese 3 – Because I can’t help myself.

I will also audit as many of Julia Wargaski‘s classes as I can manage.  She teaches typography and information design.  Her style is fierce and guided by gut instinct.

Should I feel overwhelmed?  I’m just kinda totally excited.
